mrutherfurd@... wrote:

>  > A compiler doesn't know that I have a runtime dependency that is not
>  > also a compile-time dependency. Example: method invocation via
> reflection.
> 
> I must admit that this is one of the major reasons I'm so leery of
> reflection except in *extremely* isolated cases. The runtime performance
> hit is not really a big deal in most cases but I have a BIG problem with
> the compile-time loss of dependency info and automatic type safety.

Interesting.

I don't want compile time type safety. In fact, I want 
Smalltalk/Ruby/Python.

As for 100% compile time dependencies, I've never made it a priority, so 
I don't know what I'd do with it. Hm.

> PS I've the sample chapter of your book. It is now on the top of my "must
> get" list.

Thanks. I hope you enjoy it!
